attributes.action: Compulsorily Oblige all GPs in Britain to Reopen Fully
attributes.background: It is time that GPs went back to work.  They must compulsorily open up their practices fully and see patients face to face and without any initial interrogation by medically unqualified staff. Video calls are inadequate and can never replace a private consultation in person...

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about the provision of local NHS services, including GPs, are a matter for Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) and individual practitioners, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Create a legal right for patients to receive timely face-to-face GP appointments: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/587701
